RT @sbyrnes: @thomask Agreed, I call this the Frequency of Utility. https://t.co/vObW877EnX
10/ ... Have a low frequency/ low value transaction, you are screwed - pivot, quit, rethink - and be honest with yourself!
9/ customer acquisition cost is the most expensive part of most businesses - if you have to acquire customers and ...
8/ buying new car: a/ medium problem b/ every 3-5 years for small subset of adults c/ $2000 (dealer take) = not so good business
7/ Google search: a/huge problem solved for many people b/Used 10-20/times per day c/ pennies per "transaction" aka search query = good biz
6/ when you plan your startup think about a/ problem you solve b/ how often problem occurs c/ value per transaction e.g. ....
5/ @uber started as an infrequent purchase (black car rides, mostly to airports) and became a frequent purchase - I use @uber almost daily
4/ realtors solve a very infrequent problem - how often do you buy a place? But they charge/make a lot per transaction.
3/ food is a daily problem @postmates @Sprig @blueapron serve a daily need and the valuations speak for that
2/ it matters how often people/users have the problem you are trying to solve
1/ building something people want is just not enough
